page.title: 20CREDITS
page.content: ALMONDS WOOD AND VERGE AND HEDGEROW WERE RESEARCHED BY THE 5th FORM GIRLS WITH MRS BURKE, THEIR TEACHER. THE FARMING TOPICS WERE COVERED OVER A PERIOD OF ONE MONTH BY VARIOUS FORMS WITH THE HELP OF THE GEOGRAPHY TEACHER MR DAVIES. THE DESCRIPTIVE TOPICS ARE THE RESULT OF VARIOUS VISITS BY MR BARBER, THE ENGLISH TEACHER, WITH VARIOUS PUPILS TO PEOPLE WHO LET THEM VISIT THEIR PROPERTY WHILE GIVING THEM INFORMATION ABOUT THEMSELVES AND THEIR SURROUNDINGS.THE NURSERY WAS VISITED BY THE UPPER FIFTH WHO WERE ASTONISHED BY THE COMPLEXITY OF THE TRADE. THE TOPICS INVOLVING SOCIAL CONCERNS WERE RESEARCHED THOUROUGHLY BY THE GIRLS' COMMON ENTRANCE FORM, MRS ARCHER THEIR ENGLISH TEACHER AND MR ASSAYAG THE COORDINATOR OF THIS PROJECT.THE CENSUS WAS THE WORK OF THE 6th FORM WITH MR BURFIELD THE HEADMASTER.
